page.title: 07LIVESTOCK REARING N-E LEICS.
page.content: On a mixed farm here sheep, beef or dairy cattle or occasionally pigs may be kept. {BEEF CATTLE These are often bought at market as "STORES";aged obout 18 months,they are {neutered male cattle}known as "beasts" in this area.They are kept outside in the summer months and under cover in winter when they are on silage, barley and other concentrates.The aim in keeping these beasts is to fatten them as quickly as possible.Main breeds-Freisian-Hereford crosses. Some farms keep{calves,}bought at market at a few days old. These are weaned on milk and special calf feed often containing anti-biotics, which act as growth promoters.Calf rearing is often undertaken by smallholders as the animals may be kept under cover much of the time.
